intro: Haplopappus ciliatus, commonly known as the silky pappus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and wind-dispersed seeds. The plant features narrow, linear leaves with finely toothed margins, and its flowers are typically small and yellowish. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Haplopappus ciliatus is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with minimal water requirements.
